For the successful completion of my graduation project, I led the development of a cutting-edge prototype: A Bionic Hand.
This advanced prosthetic hand was meticulously designed and 3D printed, incorporating state-of-the-art technologies such as electromyography (EMG) sensors and servo-motors.
The unique feature of this innovation lies in its ability to be controlled intuitively through muscle signals.
